name: Sunharbor
economy_niches: Caravel and cutter shipyards (specialized hulls for long routes)
Re-export warehouses for ritual reagents and imported goods
Charter brokerage, freight insurance and notary services
culture_adjustments: Stronger charterist merchant networks overriding single clan dominance
High pragmatic tolerance for islander migrant customs and Island Creole elements
Larger public role for navigational augury houses tied to ship guilds
Ritual seamanship practices integrated into daily dockwork (practical, less arcane spectacle)
risks: harbor silting and reduced access for larger ships
constraints: Ritual magic usage depends on scarce imported reagents (limits large-scale ritual work)
Limited industrial steam capacity; heavy mechanization constrained
notes: Key regional node for State_2's re-export trade and maritime taxes
Prominent augury lighthouse houses double as merchant patron chapels
